title: Martin Bartfeld and Bruce McGuinness filming A Time to Dream in Melbourne
brief_description: In the late 1960s and early 70s, the Black Power movement emerged from cities and suburbs around Australia. Activist, Koori leader and filmmaker Bruce McGuinness helped strengthen the intersection of activism and filmmaking with his politically charged Black Fire (1972).
